title: Christmas trivia; The ten-day quiz: part 5
text:
Set 9In which city is there a statue of Hans Christian Andersen in the Rosenborg Castle Gardens?Which Californian city is named after an 18th century bishop and philosopher?Which country was the subject of three partitions in the late 18th century?Which city hosts the annual Nobel Prize awards?Which US state is separated into three “grand divisions”?What theme connects these answers?

Set 10Which 1950s singer, who was partially deaf, is mentioned in the lyrics of the song “Come on Eileen” by Dexy's Midnight Runners?Which member of the Monty Python group trained as a doctor?Which Methodist preacher founded the Salvation Army?Which Disney cartoon character (a rabbit) was created before Mickey Mouse?What was the birth name of the boxer Muhammad Ali?What theme connects these answers?

…

These are the answers to yesterday's questions:

Set 7: Carrie Fisher, Stand By Your Man, Salem, the misery index, Shining Path.The theme is Stephen King novels: Carrie, The Stand, ‘Salem's Lot, Misery, The Shining.

Set 8: Carol Moseley Braun, Oliver Hardy, In the Bleak Midwinter, The Times, mutual funds.The theme is Charles Dickens novels: A Christmas Carol, Oliver Twist, Bleak House, Hard Times, Our Mutual Friend.
